Crime_Name: Refugee Claim and Pre-Removal Risk Assessment
Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer erred in assessing documentary evidence, ignoring testimonial evidence, and determining if discrimination amounted to persecution
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections 96 and 97
UNHCR Handbook on Procedures and Criteria for Determining Refugee Status
Evidence_Assessment: failed to comprehensively consider evidence on state protection and cumulative discrimination
Legal_Rule: Assessment of persecution under refugee law
evaluation of risk based on documentary and testimonial evidence
Procedural_Issue: inadequate analysis of persecution and state protection
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution as a member of the Roma ethnic group in Hungary
Outcome_on_Merits: Court found the PRRA decision unreasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision lacked procedural fairness due to selective use of evidence and failure to address key claims
Key_Evidence_Considered: testimonial evidence related to discrimination against Roma in Hungary
Applicant_Challenge: PRRA officer ignored testimonial evidence and failed to properly assess persecution
Court_Result: case remanded for reevaluation by another immigration officer
Remedy_Sought: Reevaluation of PRRA by another officer
Claimant_Status: Roma ethnic group member claiming persecution
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of persecution based on ethnicity
Governing_Rule: UNHCR Handbook on Procedures and Criteria for Determining Refugee Status
